title: Republicans, Braced for Losses, Push More Voting Restrictions in Congress
summary: Legislation that would require proof of citizenship to register to vote was only the beginning as the G.O.P. presses to sharply limit voting in line with President Trump’s false claims of widespread fraud.

title: What to Know About How Redistricting Is Different in the U.S.
summary: In the battle for Congress, redistricting has become all the rage in America. Other nations have guardrails in place to avoid the same situation.

title: An Architect of Virginia’s Redistricting Will Run for a New Seat Himself
summary: Dan Helmer, a Democratic state lawmaker, played a key role in putting redrawn congressional maps before state voters.

title: Colbert Says CBS Barred Interview With Democrat, and Search Teams Scramble After Lake Tahoe Avalanche
summary: Plus, Brad Pitt vs. Tom Cruise?

title: Trump Bets on Diplomacy Without Diplomats
summary: President Trump’s most trusted envoys, Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, are at the center of the Iran and Ukraine negotiations.

title: Talks on Russia-Ukraine War Enter 2nd Day in Geneva
summary: The discussions in Geneva were expected to focus on territorial issues, a major sticking point, but the short duration suggests major progress was not made.

title: Democrats Plan to Counter Trump’s Speech to Congress With Rally
summary: The House Democratic leader has asked rank-and-file members to sit quietly at the speech or skip it altogether, wary of creating a distraction.

title: Viral Videos Helped Mamdani Win. Can They Help Him Govern?
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani, who won over voters with his approach to social media, is using the same strategy to try to connect City Hall to all New Yorkers.

title: Mamdani Threatens 9.5% Property Tax Increase if Wealth Tax Is Not Passed
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani said his proposal to raise New York City property taxes was a “last resort” to close a budget gap.

title: A Police Parking Lot in East Harlem Will Become Affordable Housing
summary: The project is the latest example of a push by New York City to build homes on land it owns. The building will be 100 percent affordable, officials say.

title: How Jesse Jackson Took King’s Civil Rights Movement to Company Doorsteps
summary: Mr. Jackson was critical to Martin Luther King Jr.’s quest to transform a fight for equality in the South to a national movement for economic and social justice.

title: How a Stray Quote of Jesse Jackson’s Led to a Rupture Between Black and Jewish Voters
summary: The candidate’s reference to New York as “Hymietown” helped tank his 1984 presidential campaign and eroded a longstanding alliance.

title: Jesse Jackson’s Death Arrives at a Crucial Moment for Black Political Power
summary: There are more Black senators than ever before, but a major Supreme Court ruling could reduce Black representation in the House.

title: When Did Chicken Become the Most Expensive Thing on the Menu?
summary: The once-humble plate of poultry has been elevated to luxury status, with prices hitting $50 or more.

title: Nine Skiers Still Missing After Lake Tahoe Avalanche
summary: The avalanche struck a guided backcountry skiing group near Truckee, Calif., near the end of a multiday trip, officials said. Six skiers have been rescued.

title: 4 Dead in Colorado Crash as Strong Winds Kick Up Wildfire Warnings
summary: High winds were fueling the risk of wildfires across the Southwest and the Plains, and an Oklahoma town faced a mandatory evacuation. Officials said the weather had caused a deadly pileup in Colorado.

title: White House Shrugs Off Lutnick’s Epstein Ties
summary: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick has acknowledged traveling to Jeffrey Epstein’s island and meeting him on another occasion.

title: Alberto Tomba Was an ’80s and ’90s Icon. The Olympics Have Brought Him Back.
summary: Nicknamed “Tomba la Bomba,” the Italian skier was a global superstar before he drifted from the limelight. Decades later, the Winter Games have given him a new platform.

title: A New Concern About Weight Loss Drugs: What if They Work Too Well?
summary: Some patients in a clinical trial of one new drug lost so much weight that they became concerned and dropped out.

title: At These Gaza Schools, ‘Peace Building’ Is Part of the Curriculum
summary: A fast-growing network of private schools, the brainchild of a North Carolina neurosurgeon, is teaching 9,000 war orphans and other needy Palestinian youngsters.

title: The Sleepy Market for Japanese Government Bonds Is Now a ‘Battlefield’
summary: Trading of Japanese government bonds, long considered moribund, is roaring back to life as fears of the country’s debt have sent yields surging.

title: Trump Hails Japan’s First Batch of U.S. Investments
summary: The deals, totaling $36 billion, were the first step in a $550 billion investment pledge aimed at securing tariff relief and sustaining U.S. relations.

title: A Road Trip from Kandahar to Kabul on Highway 1 in Afghanistan
summary: Life and business are back along a road once defined by war damage. But even with improved security, Afghans are desperate for jobs and development.

title: A Downtown Vibe Comes to Broadway This Spring
summary: Without the usual flood of new musicals, the playwrights of works like “Becky Shaw,” “Dog Day Afternoon” and “Giant” are getting a chance to shine.

title: ‘Brokeback Mountain,’ ‘Black Swan’ and 14 More Plays and Musicals to See This Spring
summary: Across the country, a flurry of theater productions, including “Black Swan” and “The Lunchbox,” are mining the movies for material.

title: What to See in NYC This Spring: Broadway Shows, Concerts and More
summary: Onstage, “Cats: The Jellicle Ball” and Adrien Brody in “The Fear of 13.” Plus: Cardi B goes on tour, Lise Davidsen takes on Isolde at the Met, 100 years of Martha Graham and more.

title: Democrats Win in Texas With Candidates Like Taylor Rehmet
summary: A shock Democratic victory in a Texas special election shows what the party needs to do to win more there — and many other places, too.

title: The A.I. Disruption Has Arrived, and It Sure Is Fun
summary: We’re entering a new renaissance of software development. We should all be excited, despite the uncertainties that lie ahead.

title: Remembering Jesse Jackson
summary: We look back at the life and legacy of an American who helped shape our politics and our culture.

title: Stephen Colbert Finds a Place to File CBS’s Surprise Statement
summary: “I don’t even know what to do with this,” Colbert said about the network’s news release on a scrapped interview with a Democratic politician, before putting the paper in a dog waste bag.

title: California Wealth Tax Opponents Intensify Efforts Before Bernie Sanders Visit
summary: The opponents’ latest moves include online ads tied to Gov. Gavin Newsom, a crypto-related push to raise money and competing ballot measures.

title: Methane Hunters Track Swamp Gas That Is Driving Climate Warming
summary: Methane emissions from wetlands are rising faster than those from industrial sources, prompting concerns about a climate feedback loop.

title: Uber Taking Steps to Expand Number of EV Chargers Near Its Drivers
summary: The company said it would encourage companies that operated chargers to install them in neighborhoods where its drivers lived and work.
